title: Data Visualization and Visual Analytics
description:
Taught a graduate-level course on data visualization principles and visual analytics techniques. The course covered fundamental concepts of visual perception, visualization design, and interactive systems for data exploration.

Students completed projects applying visualization techniques to real-world datasets. Topics included network visualization, time series visualization, multidimensional data representation, and evaluation methods for visualization systems.

title: Introduction to Machine Learning
description:
Developed and delivered an undergraduate course introducing students to machine learning fundamentals. The course balanced theoretical foundations with practical implementation skills.

Topics included supervised and unsupervised learning, model evaluation, feature engineering, and ethical considerations in ML applications. Weekly labs provided hands-on experience with Python, scikit-learn, and TensorFlow.

title: Human-Computer Interaction
description:
Taught an undergraduate course on principles and practices of human-computer interaction. The course covered user-centered design methodologies, usability testing, interface design patterns, and prototyping techniques.

Students worked in teams to design and evaluate interactive systems, applying HCI principles to create more usable and accessible interfaces. The course included guest lectures from industry practitioners and a final design showcase.

title: Advanced Topics in Data Science
description:
Led a seminar course exploring cutting-edge research in data science. Students read and discussed recent academic papers, analyzed state-of-the-art techniques, and presented their findings to the class.

Topics included deep learning architectures, reinforcement learning applications, explainable AI, and ethical issues in data science. Students also completed a research project investigating an advanced topic of their choice.

title: Programming for Data Analysis
description:
Designed and taught an introductory programming course focused on data analysis applications. The course introduced programming concepts using Python with an emphasis on data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.

Students learned to work with libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib to solve real-world data problems. The course included weekly programming assignments and a final project analyzing a dataset of the student's choice.
